intro: Clinelymus tangutorum, commonly known as the Tibetan thistle, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. It is adapted to arid and cold environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh conditions. Clinelymus tangutorum is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows, where it plays a role in stabilizing the soil and supporting local biodiversity.
